Name: Broadcasting of mandatory debates.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the broadcasting of mandatory debates

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Filed (End of Session)

Attachments.Name: December 11, 2017 - Stated Meeting Agenda with Links to Files

Summary: This bill would require that mandatory debates under the Campaign Finance Act be broadcast on a City owned or operated television channel, in addition to any other channel or channels on which they are broadcast.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
       
      Section 1. Section 3-709.5 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended to add a new subdivision 13, to read as follows:
      13. In addition to any broadcast plan adopted pursuant to paragraph (vii) of subdivision 5 of this section, each debate held pursuant to this section shall be broadcast simultaneously on the city-owned or operated television channel serving the largest public audience.
      ï¿½ 2. This local law takes effect on January 1, 2018.
